physical_examinations.vital_signs: Hypertensive; Blood pressure well controlled with propranolol (30 mg/d) and phenoxybenzamine (30 mg/d).
physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Recurrent spells of throbbing headache, palpitations, diaphoresis, and anxiety. Increased 24-h urinary excretion of catecholamines and total metanephrines.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: No normalization of urinary catecholamines and metanephrines postoperatively; persistent elevation noted over follow-ups.

physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Presented with low back and hip pain. Bone scan showed increased uptake in the proximal left femur, consistent with a 3.5 cm lytic lesion.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Metastatic lesion in the femur remained unchanged over the next decade.

physical_examinations.relevant_findings: [123I]MIBG scan showed uptake in the liver, left femur, and posterior mediastinum. MRI showed a 2-cm nodule inferior to the right pulmonary artery.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: No significant changes in findings compared to previous imaging.

physical_examinations.vital_signs: Blood pressure well controlled with propranolol and phenoxybenzamine.
physical_examinations.relevant_findings: MRI of abdomen showed a large hypervascular lobulated mass in the liver, causing complete occlusion of the vena cava.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: No pronounced change in size of the mass compared to previous images over 22 years; the patient remained asymptomatic.
